content: Not every message deserves more than a 204 No Content or 200 OK to understand "OK, it was recieved". However, I cannot figured out how to get the HAPI Generic client to NOT throw an exception when sending a POST to an endpoint that does little more than return 200 OK. Is there something simple I'm missing? It seems like telling the client that it's posting to $process-message in asynch way should do it, but I keep getting errors about no JSON in the response. @James Agnew
@Eric Haas is also interested in this topic.
Sounds like a client bug, assuming the server isn't returning a content-type header...

I'd say it is a client bug. I also get an error when Content-Type is forced to null (during debug) though. I couldn't figure out a way to avoid getting an exception back when there is no content in response to $process-message.
Where are we with this? @Keith Boone did you have to modify the code at the CMS Connectathon or able to use the Java Client out of the box. @James Agnew what do we need to do next. log a tracker?

I think this was recently fixed: https://github.com/jamesagnew/hapi-fhir/pull/1603

Can you try it with the current 4.2.0 snapshot builds to see if you see it resolved?
I will defer to the AI team to confirm. But thanks!!
